title: Girl, 2, with allergy rushed to hospital after Frankie and Benny's
text:
The mum said her little girl began to feel unwell after eating pasta at Frankie and Benny’s (Picture: Google Maps)

A terrified mother had to rush her young daughter to A&E after suffering an allergic reaction when she ate a pasta dish at Frankie and Benny’s.

Davita Thandi, from Leicester, took her two-year-old daughter for dinner at the Italian-American chain in Great Yarmouth on September 17.

The mother said she told staff her daughter had a dairy allergy and that the pair were both vegans.

She ordered a vegan pizza for her daughter and vegan pasta for herself, but minutes after her little girl tried her dish she started complaining that she felt unwell.

Davita told the Eastern Daily Press: ‘She ate a little bit of my pasta and moments after she started to say her tummy was hurting and she started getting clammy. At that point, we thought she was having a reaction.’

The little girl’s condition quickly deteriorated and Davita rushed her to Paget University hospital, in Gorleston.

There, a doctor told the worried mother her daughter’s reaction ‘could be really serious’.

‘When we went to A and E, she started to pass out. She was scratching her body, her ears and lips were swelling,’ she told the news site.

Luckily, the little girl’s condition began to improve overnight after being given Penicillin and steroids.

Davita complained to the restaurant about their ordeal but claimed she was told that cheese had been cross contaminated with the pizza.

But the mother pointed out it was the pasta that had been the issue, adding that her daughter has never suffered such a severe reaction to cross-contamination.

A Frankie and Benny’s spokesperson said: ‘We are aware of an incident that took place at our site in Great Yarmouth on September 17 and are in direct contact with the customers involved.

‘We are conducting an urgent investigation to determine what has taken place.

‘We have very strict policies and guidelines with regards to allergens and all our staff are trained in this area and follow clear protocols.’

description: A little girl, from Leicester, suffered an allergic reaction to dairy at Frankie and Benny's after eating 'vegan pasta'.
